newsitem.title: UK: OPTIONS - Brit Steel straddles sold for time value.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS - Brit Steel straddles sold for time value.

text.p: Heavy trading in British Steel options made these the most active UK stock options by mid-afternoon on Friday, dealers said.
The biggest deal was the sale of 2,000 April 140 puts and calls at 4p and 8p each. A further 1,000 lots in the same series were subsequently sold at the same prices.

A short straddle is a way of making money from selling options time premium and maximum profit will be made at expiry if the underlying stock is then at the strike price because the options will then be worthless.
With the shares unchanged at 143-3/4p at 1530 GMT, time value for the calls is now 4-1/4p and for the puts it's 4p.
Maximum profit at expiry will be 12p if British Steel shares are 140p. But the deals may have been to hedge against a shareholding in British Steel.

In this instance there is limited upside profit potential -- owing to the short calls which may be assigned -- and there is a risk of large losses if the share price falls -- because of the combination of short puts and long stock.
Elsewhere, there was mixed trading in British Petroleum.
One deal was the purchase of 500 April 700 puts at 31p, another was the sale of 250 July 750 calls at 18-1/2p.

In Cadbury Schweppes renewed bid speculation in soft drinks and confectionery group may have been behind the main deal in its options which was the purchase of 385 May 500 calls at prices between 16p and 17p.
